answers.answer:
Essential hygiene practices include frequent hand washing with soap and water or using hand sanitizer, and ensuring individual or thoroughly cleaned shared utensils are used.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read under the sections "Hand washing" and "Use of utensils".
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read under the sections "Hand washing" and "Use of utensils". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene

answers.answer:
To wash your hands properly, open the tap, soap your palms, carefully rub the inside and back of your hands, then wash off the soap and close the tap. In public places, it is best to use a paper towel to open and close the faucet.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and read under the "Hand washing" section.
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer:
It is most important to wash hands often with soap, especially after visiting the toilet, after being on public transport or touching outside surfaces (including money), before cooking and eating, after contact with a pet, and before any self-care or child-care procedures.

To find this information, go to the website and read under the section titled 'Hand washing'.
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer:
Alternatives for hand cleaning when soap and water are unavailable include hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol, or alcohol and antibacterial wet wipes.

You can find this information on the website by navigating to the "Hygiene" section, then looking under "Hand washing," and specifically the subsection "What to do if there is no or limited access to soap and water."

answers.answer:
In a bomb shelter, 0.5-1 litres of technical water is needed daily per person for hygiene. If mostly in an apartment or house, about 7.5 litres of water per day is needed for a broader set of needs including body washing and washing.

You can find this information on the website dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene, within the main text of the 'Hygiene' section, specifically where it discusses water needs in crisis situations and bomb shelters.

answers.answer:
Children should use their own individual or disposable dishes, or common dishes must be thoroughly washed, especially the edges, with detergents before use. It is also not recommended to drink directly from the tap.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene under the section "Use of utensils".
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer:
To create a homemade diaper from gauze, fold a piece of gauze into 3-4 layers to form a paddle. Place this paddle on a triangle made from another piece of gauze, then position the baby on the triangle with the paddle reaching the middle of their back, and fold the triangle like panties, trimming edges carefully.

For detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene and navigate to the "Diapers" section, then look under "How to make a diaper out of gauze."

answers.answer:
To make a diaper from a piece of cloth, fold the cloth in four and bend it towards you. Place your finger between the folds, holding the tip of the cloth with the other hand, then push its end to make a triangle. Turn the cloth triangle upside down and fold the remaining residue into two layers to create a gasket in the middle.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene under the "Diapers" section, specifically "How to make a diaper from a piece of cloth."

answers.answer:
Yes, it is possible to reuse disposable diapers by soaking them to make the gel swell, then making an incision to remove the gel and contents, rinsing and drying the diaper, and finally inserting a gauze or cloth pad.

You can find detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/hygiene under the "Diapers" section, specifically within the "How to use disposable diapers several times" heading.
